local.name: Local Model
local._note: API key references .env file - DO NOT hardcode keys here

online2.name: OpenAI Compatible API
online2._note: API key references .env file - DO NOT hardcode keys here

prompts.oneshot_system_prompt: You are a pharmacy prescription verification agent. Compare the entered vs original prescription data and provide accurate matching scores. Be strict, give low scores for human review if you are not sure, give 0 if you cannot extract info from the original.
prompts.oneshot_user_prompt:
The image shows a prescription verification screen with two sections.

Left side (entered data, left 1/3 of the screenshot):

Patient info (green background)

Prescriber info (yellow background)

Drug & direction info (blue background)

Use the long direction text at the bottom left for comparison (ignore short sigs like “1qd”).

Right side (original prescription - righ 2/3 of the screenshot):

The original prescription for verification.

TASK

Step 1 – Analyze the LEFT side (entered data) first.
Extract and describe:

Patient information

Prescriber information

Drug (name, strength, dosage form)

Directions (long text only)

Step 2 – Analyze the RIGHT side (original prescription).
Extract and describe the same four fields from the original document.

Step 3 – Compare.
Compare the LEFT (entered data) and RIGHT (original prescription) field by field:

Patient (name, phone number, dob, and address ALL need to be match)

Prescriber (name, phone number, NPI, and address ALL need to be match)

Drug (name, strength, and dosage form ALL need to be match/equvalent)

Direction (dosage and frequency semantically match)

Explain whether each field matches, differs, or is unclear.

Step 4 – Score.
Assign a numeric match score for each field using this scale:

100 = Perfect match or full equivalent

85–95 = Good match (minor or formatting differences, equivalent drug, or sematically equivalent)

70–84 = Acceptable but needs review (similar but not identical)

0–69 = Poor match or unclear

OUTPUT RULES

The final response must include only the JSON object shown below.

Do not include explanations, reasoning text, or commentary after the JSON.

Output format:

{
  "patient": score,
  "prescriber": score,
  "drug": score,
  "direction": score
}

vlm_settings._max_tokens_cap_help: Optional safety limit for max_tokens. Set to null (no limit) or a number like 4000 to prevent excessive API costs. System will warn and cap if profile max_tokens exceeds this value.
